Journal.Title: Huan jing ke xue= Huanjing kexue

Article.ArticleTitle: [Characteristics of Advanced Treatment of Treated Petrochemical Water by O<sub>3</sub>-BAC and Analysis of Consortium Structure].

AbstractText: The advanced treatment of treated petrochemical water by Ozone-Biological Activated Carbon (O<sub>3</sub>-BAC) was carried out in this study. The effect of O<sub>3</sub> on the removal of Chemical Oxygen Demand (COD) and Spectral Absorption Coefficient (UV<sub>254</sub>) were investigated. The characteristics of organic matter and the microbial consortium structure of BAC were also investigated at 20 mg·L<sup>-1</sup> of O<sub>3</sub> dosage concentration, 40 min of O<sub>3</sub> single stage contact time and 1.5 h of the empty bed residence time of BAC. Results showed that the effluent COD concentration of O<sub>3</sub>-BAC was 24 mg·L<sup>-1</sup> with the removal efficiency of 40.4%. The COD removal efficiency of O<sub>3</sub>-BAC was higher than that for the BAC process. The UV<sub>254</sub> removal efficiency of O<sub>3</sub>-BAC was 55.1%. Meanwhile, UV<sub>254</sub> correlated with COD with a correlation coefficient of 0.89. The percentage of dissolved organic matters with relative molecular weight less than 1×10<sup>3</sup> increased from 69.0% to 87.0% after O<sub>3</sub> oxidation. The NPOC removal efficiency of O<sub>3</sub>-BAC (45.8%) was higher than that of the BAC process (23.0%). The NPOC removal efficiency of the BAC unit was mainly achieved by reduction of dissolved organic matters with relative molecular weight less than 1×10<sup>3</sup>. GC-MS analysis results showed that organic substances such as alkanes, unsaturated esters, and phenols had been removed by O<sub>3</sub> oxidation. The micro ecological environment of the BAC unit had been significantly improved after O<sub>3</sub> oxidation, and the genera with relative abundance over 1.0% increased from 6 to 11. The combined O<sub>3</sub>-BAC system can be applied to the advanced treatment of petrochemical treated water.
